import React from "react"; import {Container, Row, Col} from "react-bootstrap"; import {Link} from "react-router-dom"; import DocumentMeta from "react-document-meta"; function Top15TrendsinNursingJobtoWatchforIndianJobSeekers() { const meta = { title: "Top 15 Trends in Nursing Job to Watch for Indian Job Seekers", description: "Top 15 Trends in Nursing Job to Watch for Indian Job Seekers: Education, Technology Support, Progress in Communication, Working with educated customers, Integrative skills.", canonical: "https://www.mbbsadmissionsinabroad.com/top-15-trends-in-nursing-job-to-watch-for-indian-job-seekers", meta: { charset: "utf-8", name: { keywords: "Top 15 Trends in Nursing Job to Watch for Indian Job Seekers" } } }; return (

Top 15 Trends in Nursing Job to Watch for Indian Job Seekers

Most people are looking into{" "} nursing as a good career {" "} field to study healthcare because{" "} nursing is a rewarding job . Nursing is one of the best careers that various nurses have decided to work beyond retirement age which may be one of the contributing factors to the recent nursing shortage. Nurses also get paid well.

{/* */}

Here are the top 15 trends in nursing job to watch:

  • {" "} Education: Nowadays, nurses have a new set of things to learn because of changes in patient demographics. Nurses must understand the requirements of a diverse and aging population.
  • {" "} Technology Support: The majority of medical facilities are starting to embrace increasing technology like smart phones, TVs and tablets technologies to reduce administration time and to increase accuracy in treatment and medical records keeping. Nurses are now expected to utilized computer technology to get patient information, save patient information and even look up treatment options when necessary.
  • {" "} Progress in Communication: The advancements in communication as well as technology both have assisted the medical community reach out to those who were unable to commute to a hospital or other care facility. Nurses are able to communicate with these individuals to give them with medical information or even prescriptions.
  • {" "} Working with Educated Customers: The customers are more educated than ever about their health, and about how nutrition and exercise plays a huge role in retaining longevity and preventing diseases. Pharmaceutical commercials also inform customers about which medications might work for their particular medical conditions.
  • {" "} Increasing difficulty of Patient Care: The majority of chronic diseases patients are inpatients that are suffering from acute illnesses need special care. The nurses should have a specific level of management, administrative and medical skills to deal with the new changes that healthcare reform and an aging population have caused.
  • {" "} Healthcare’s increased Price: The patients are not able to get the level of care that required preventing chronic illnesses & diseases from developing as the cost of healthcare increases. This leads to an increase in severely ill patients and higher hospital bills & increased health care prices.
  • {" "} Changes in Federal & State Regulations: The patients are worried that if they don't have a managed care cover, they won't get the same level of treatment that a person with traditional insurance would. Nurses should be aware of how these changes affect patients to adequately treat them and provide them the level of care they need.
  • {" "} Integrative Skills: The nurses are starting to learn interdisciplinary skills so that they are able to deal with an extensive variety of disciplines including dental & social issues.
  • {" "} Work beyond Retirement Age: Due to the recent nursing shortage, nurses are working beyond retirement age.
  • {" "} Development in Nursing & Science Research: The increase in nursing scholarships in research has lead to better patient care & an improvement with the way that patients experience treatment.
  • {" "} Popularity of Online Education Programs: Online nursing degree programs offer a way for nurses to get a degree while continuing to work full-time, opportunities for higher education without sacrificing work-related responsibilities.
  • {" "} Various states will grant Nurse Practitioners full practice authority: {" "} Currently, 22 states including Washington D.C. grant nurse practitioners full practice authority & other states need collaborative agreement with a supervising physician or have restrictions on practice.
  • {" "} More valued of Bilingual Nurses: Next to English, Spanish is the most widely spoken language in the US. Bilingualism is becoming increasingly valued as a skill for nurses to have. Nurses who can able to speak a second language especially Spanish may get better opportunities than monolingual nurses.
  • {" "} More valued of Bilingual Nurses: Next to English, Spanish is the most widely spoken language in the US. Bilingualism is becoming increasingly valued as a skill for nurses to have. Nurses who can able to speak a second language especially Spanish may get better opportunities than monolingual nurses.
  • {" "} Proportion of Male Nurses will increase: The share of nurses who are male went up from 2.2% in 1960 to 13% in 2015. More men realize the benefits of a career in nursing, so there would be proportion of male nurses to increase.
  • {" "} Demand for Geriatric Specialists will increase: More geriatric nurses will be needed to deal with an aging and ailing population of Baby Boomers.

Dr Vinit Kumar is a Educational Consultant for India & Abroad with more than 18 Years of Experience.He has an extensive background guiding & assisting medical students to find the best university as per their budget.✔3500 + Students✔ 15 Countries✔ MBBS, MBA, PG, UG✔ 100 % Commitment✔ Education Loan✔ Job Placements

); } export default Top15TrendsinNursingJobtoWatchforIndianJobSeekers
